meanings.definition: Of or relating to a map projection in which the surface of a sphere is depicted as a plane.
meanings.sent1: The stereographic map helped us understand the globe better by showing it on a flat surface.
meanings.sent2: The stereographic representation of the Earth made it easier to study different regions.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fold a globe into a stereographic shape, but it just looked like a crumpled paper.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a stereographic way, always simplifying complex ideas into easy-to-understand concepts.
meanings.sent5: The stereographic view of the world from above was both fascinating and enlightening.

meanings.definition: A type of photograph or image that appears three-dimensional.
meanings.sent1: The stereographic picture seemed to pop out of the frame, creating a 3D effect.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed looking at the stereographic images that made objects look real and close.
meanings.sent3: The cat stared curiously at the stereographic photo, trying to figure out if it was a real mouse.
meanings.sent4: His memories of that day were like a stereographic image, vivid and lifelike in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The stereographic photograph of the mountains made them seem within arm's reach.
